Common Ecological Data: Proportions or percents that are not ones or zeros
Count or abundance data with overdispersion
Count or abundance data with overdispersion
Count or abundance data with too many zeros
Count or abundance data with too many zeros and overdispersion
Count or abundance data that won't have zeros (e.g. only counted when they were present)
Count or abundance data that won't have zeros and that is overdispersed

Distribution: Poisson or negative binomial families with an offset term
Common Ecological Data: Density data, Count or abundance data with unequal sample sizes
Continuous data derived from count data (e.g. tree biomasses) that will have too many zeros
